comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: There's a lecture series named for her, at the American Genetic Association's annual symposium: www.theaga.org/2010/key_lecture.php She also published a report in 1915 titled "Feeble-Minded Citizens in Pennsylvania," based on eugenic pedigrees of a population in rural Pennsylvania. books.google.com/books?id=x0biAAAAMAAJ

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: Key was very active in the American Eugenics Society as well. Eugenics....what a different time. We have an interesting click! photography changes everything piece by Carol Squiers that examines and critiques the role of photography in eugenics that I think is worth a read: click.si.edu/Story.aspx?story=762 Thanks for sharing the information, Penny. Best, Catherine Shteynberg Smithsonian Institution Archives
